course_title: Special Topics in Chemistry: Advance Organic Chemistry
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 60 / Seats Avail: 6Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
The course will build on the foundational principles of your earlier chemistry courses: molecular orbital theory, organic reaction mechanisms, stereochemistry, and the relationships between structure and reactivity, to advance a deeper understanding of organic chemistry.  
 
This course is a natural progression for students who especially enjoyed CHEM-203 (Advanced Reactivity) and would like to continue learning in the same vein.  
 
We will continue our progress in the Clayden Organic Chemistry textbook. In their preface, the intrepid authors encourage you to; keep `one foot inside the boundary of the known, the other just outside'. I join the authors in encouraging you to do the same.
course_description: A seminar for advanced students on topics of current interest in chemistry.
prerequisites: CHEM 204 or CHEM_OX 204 or CHEM 205 or CHEM_OX 205 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 2942, Section #: 2, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 2:40-3:55p, Instructor: M. Weinschenk, Status: Open
